properties.notes_pt: Tempo em fam√≠lia, anivers√°rio da v√≥ e do Pedrinho, preparativos pra viagem e come√ßo da aventura!
properties.notes_en: Family time, grandma and Pedrinho's birthdays, travel preparations, and the start of the adventure!

properties.notes_pt: Primeiro dia da viagem foi um sucesso! Belas paisagens do litoral norte do RN, uma travessia de balsa, um trecho dificil na areia fofa e os √∫ltimos 30 km de BR 101 at√© o fim dela. Bati um PF em Cajueiro e achei um lugar seguro pra acampar na varanda de uma casa, de frente pro mar. Deu pra nadar no mar, tomar uma ducha e lavar roupa. 20h j√° tava deitado pra dormir
properties.notes_en: The first day of the trip was a success! Beautiful scenery on the northern coast of Rio Grande do Norte, a ferry crossing, a difficult stretch on soft sand, and the last 30 km on the BR 101 highway to the end. I had a meal in Cajueiro and found a safe place to camp on the porch of a house facing the sea. I was able to swim in the sea, take a shower, and wash my clothes. By 8 pm, I was already lying down to sleep.

properties.notes_pt: Passei por S√£o Miguel do Gostoso, e depois de Tourinhos o primeiro trecho pela areia da praia! Na mar√© seca, entre o mar e as e√≥licas. 30 km de estrada de terra ruim pesou, enfim em Pedra Grande almocei na Dona Marta, descansei e peguei o trecho final de asfalto com vento nas costas at√© Cai√ßara do Norte, onde me indicaram um local seguro pra acampar. Mergulho no mar e belo p√¥r do sol. Hamilton desenrolou uma mangueira pra eu tomar banho. Fiz minha janta, meu acampamentinho e conversei com umas crian√ßas que tavam ali brincando, com√©dias.
properties.notes_en: I passed through S√£o Miguel do Gostoso, and after Tourinhos, the first stretch along the beach sand! At low tide, between the sea and the wind turbines. 30 km of rough dirt road took its toll, but finally in Pedra Grande I had lunch at Dona Marta's, rested and took the final stretch of asphalt with the wind at my back to Cai√ßara do Norte, where they recommended a safe place to camp. I went for a swim in the sea and enjoyed a beautiful sunset. Hamilton unrolled a hose so I could take a shower. I made my dinner, set up my little camp and chatted with some children who were playing there, having fun.

properties.notes_pt: 25 km de pedal na areia na mar√© seca, muito bom! Passando por um trecho deserto, depois Galos e enfim Galinhos, um dos pequenos para√≠sos do RN. Passei a maior parte do dia, dei uma volta, curti a praia, almocei, vegetei, e desenrolei um barco pra ir pra Guamar√© no fim do dia.
properties.notes_en: 25 km of pedalling on the sand at low tide, very nice! Passing through a deserted stretch, then Galos and finally Galinhos, one of RN's little paradises. I spent most of the day walking around, enjoying the beach, having lunch, 'vegetating' and catching a boat to Guamar√© at the end of the day.

properties.notes_pt: Lindo por do sol no barco pra Guamar√© com o barqueiro Peluzio e outra menina. Chegando l√° fiquei prospectando um local pra dormir, at√© que optei pelo coreto de uma pra√ßa,  j√° tava bem instalado fazendo minha massa quando um senhor, seu Fran√ßa, 87 anos, veio me oferecer um quarto pra dormir. O luxo, uma su√≠te, foi √≥timo.  Gratid√£o seu Fran√ßa <3
properties.notes_en: Beautiful sunset on the boat to Guamar√© with the boatman Peluzio and another girl. When I got there, I was looking for a place to sleep, until I opted for the bandstand in a square. I was already well settled into my pasta when a man, Seu Fran√ßa, 87, offered me a room to sleep in. The luxury, a suite, was great.  Thank you, Mr Fran√ßa <3

properties.notes_pt: Entrei na regi√£o produtora de sal e petr√≥leo do RN, muitas salinas pelo caminho, ainda umas e√≥licas tamb√©m. Alguns trechos desolados quase des√©rticos. Almocei e descansei em Pend√™ncias.
properties.notes_en: I entered the salt and oil producing region of RN, many salt flats along the way, and a few wind farms too. Some desolate, almost desert-like stretches. I had lunch and rested in Pend√™ncias.

properties.notes_pt: A parte da tarde foi dif√≠cil com estrada bem ruim e alguns trechos contra o vento (mas no geral tenho que agradecer o vento pois ele costuma ajudar). Fim da tarde cheguei na praia do Rosado, no munic√≠pio de Porto do Mangue, onde seu Raimundo e fam√≠lia me receberam pra passar a noite. Dei o tradicional tibum e banho. Vento muito forte ali, a casa cheia de areia. Jantei uma sopa com a fam√≠lia. Achei legal que a fam√≠lia forma uma verdadeira comunidade de dezenas de pessoas lado a lado. Dormi na rede na varanda, foi agrad√°vel.
properties.notes_en: The afternoon was difficult, with very bad roads and some stretches against the wind (but in general I have the wind to thank, as it usually helps). In the late afternoon I arrived at Rosado beach, in the municipality of Porto do Mangue, where Raimundo and his family welcomed me for the night. I took the traditional swim and a shower. It was very windy there, and the house was full of sand. I had soup for dinner with the family. I thought it was nice that the family forms a real community of dozens of people side by side. I slept in the hammock on the veranda, it was nice.

properties.notes_pt: Voei de manh√£ pra conseguir pegar a balsa de 8h30 de Areia Branca pra Grossos. Fiz uma longa pausa em Tibau, conversei com uns ciclistas que me deram coca e gelo. Primeira fronteira estadual, entrei no Cear√°! Almocei no centrinho de Icapu√≠ e cheguei de tarde na praia do Peroba, onde fui super bem recebido por uma fam√≠lia linda que trabalha com prote√ß√£o dos peixes boi. E o espa√ßo muito bom com bela vista pro mar. Acabei ficando umas 48h de boa, encontros potentes e aprendizados!
properties.notes_en: I left in the morning to catch the 8.30am ferry from Areia Branca to Grossos. I took a long break in Tibau, chatted to some cyclists who gave me coke and ice. First state border, I've entered Cear√°! I had lunch in the centre of Icapu√≠ and arrived in the afternoon at Peroba beach, where I was warmly welcomed by a lovely family who work to protect manatees. It's a very nice place with a beautiful view of the sea. I ended up staying there for 48 hours, meeting people and learning a lot!

properties.notes_pt: Dia tranquilo no Peroba, brincando com as crian√ßas. Parti de tarde, pedalei s√≥ 2 horinhas at√© Canoa Quebrada, onde vi um lindo p√¥r do sol. Acampei nos fundos de uma barraca/bar de praia.
properties.notes_en: A quiet day in Peroba, playing with the children. I left in the afternoon and cycled just two hours to Canoa Quebrada, where I saw a beautiful sunset. I camped at the back of a beach hut/bar.

properties.notes_pt: Fiquei um pouco em Canoa Quebrada, at√© tive uma sess√£o de terapia na loja de conveni√™ncia de um posto de gasolina, fui sair s√≥ umas 11h j√° sob o ma√ßarico impiedoso do sol. Fui seguindo a rodovia estadual pouco interessante. Interessante foram as coisas a beira da estrada como coco 2 reais, d√∫zia de cajus 5 reais e por a√≠ vai. Cheguei no fim da tarde em Morro Branco perto da praia das Fontes, casal Jairo e Nice me receberam de gra√ßa no camping deles, gratid√£o!
properties.notes_en: I stayed in Canoa Quebrada for a while, even had a therapy session in the convenience store of a petrol station, but left only at 11am, already under the merciless torch of the sun. I followed the uninteresting state road. What was interesting were the things on the side of the road like coconuts for 2 reais, a dozen cashews for 5 reais and so on. I arrived in the late afternoon in Morro Branco near Praia das Fontes. Jairo and Nice welcomed me for free at their campsite, thank you!

properties.notes_pt: De manh√£ passei na Praia das Fontes, tomei um banho de mar e tirei √°gua salgada nas bicas depois foi boa parte do dia seguindo a estrada mesmo at√© entrar em Fortaleza e chegar em Ancuri, onde fui muito bem recebido pela minha prima Gabi e seu marido Call, pude tirar um cochilo e rolou churrasco e resenha.
properties.notes_en: In the morning I stopped by Praia das Fontes, took a sea bath and rinsed off the salt water at the springs. Then I spent most of the day following the road until entering Fortaleza and arriving in Ancuri, where I was warmly welcomed by my cousin Gabi and her husband Call. I was able to take a nap, and we had a barbecue and good conversation.

properties.notes_pt: Tirei um dia de descanso na casa de Gabi e Call, foi √≥timo passar esse tempo com eles e os bichos. Inclusive, deu pra remendar primeiro pneu furado da viagem. S√°bado de manh√£ parti, como previsto foi meio chato atravessar Fortaleza quase inteira, tr√¢nsito movimentado. Chegando no litoral ficou mais tranquilo, fui at√© o Pec√©m e fiz o trecho final at√© Ta√≠ba pela praia. Lindo lugar, point de kite e de surf.
properties.notes_en: I took a rest day at Gabi and Call‚Äôs house ‚Äî it was great spending time with them and the pets. I even got to patch the first flat tire of the trip. On Saturday morning I set off; as expected, crossing almost all of Fortaleza was a bit annoying due to heavy traffic. Once I reached the coast it got more peaceful. I went through Pec√©m and did the final stretch to Ta√≠ba along the beach. Beautiful place, a spot for kitesurfing and surfing.

properties.notes_pt: Dia puxado porque foi uns 20 km de 'cal√ßamento' terr√≠vel trepidando muito, e pra completar o amortecedor tava travado e eu n√£o conseguia destravar. Em Po√ßo Doce Jo√£o e amigos muito gentis me deram sopa e coca, conversamos um pouco, at√© me convidaram pra almo√ßar mesmo mas eu n√£o queria perder o hor√°rio da mar√© baixa; fiz o trecho final de Lagoinha at√© Flecheiras pela praia. Enfim deu pra relaxar no mar e achei um local √≥timo pra acampar ali na praia mesmo.
properties.notes_en: Tough day, as there were about 20 km of terrible cobblestone road shaking a lot, and to top it off the shock absorber was stuck and I couldn‚Äôt unlock it. In Po√ßo Doce, Jo√£o and some kind friends gave me soup and coke; we chatted for a while and they even invited me for lunch, but I didn‚Äôt want to miss the low tide. I did the final stretch from Lagoinha to Flecheiras along the beach. Finally, I got to relax in the sea and found a great spot to camp right there on the beach.

properties.notes_pt: Dia mais longo de pedal at√© ent√£o, 115 km, mas s√≥ no asfalto. Cheguei no fim da tarde, muita gente (muitos gringos inclusive) fazendo kite na lagoa, que na verdade √© um bra√ßo de mar. Acabei armando minha rede debaixo do deck da pra√ßa, mais protegido do vento e j√° na areia. De manh√£ inusitadamente fui acordado por uma missa logo acima de mim √†s 5h. Sa√≠ pra passear na lagoa e na praia do lado oce√¢nico. Infelizmente nesse meio tempo algu√©m furtou minha power bank. Fui partir s√≥ na hora do almo√ßo.
properties.notes_en: Longest cycling day so far ‚Äî 115 km, all on asphalt. I arrived in the late afternoon; lots of people (many foreigners too) were kitesurfing on the lagoon, which is actually a sea inlet. I ended up setting up my hammock under the deck at the square, sheltered from the wind and right on the sand. In the morning, I was unexpectedly woken up by a mass right above me at 5 a.m. I went for a walk by the lagoon and the beach on the ocean side. Unfortunately, in the meantime, someone stole my power bank. I left just in time for lunch.

properties.notes_pt: Almocei em Itarema e pedalei uns 50 km at√© a praia de Arana√∫, onde acampei numa casa desocupada e os vizinhos gentilmente cederam um banheiro com chuveiro. Encontro marcante nessa casa: achei uma gatinha rec√©m nascida abandonada, chorando. A protegi do vento e dei leite (descobri que √© ruim pra filhotes t√£o pequenos). Ela dormiu comigo na rede dentro do bolso do meu moletom. Resolvi levar ela comigo pra levar no veterin√°rio. Sa√≠mos √†s 5h da manh√£ pegando belo nascer do sol pela praia.
properties.notes_en: I had lunch in Itarema and cycled about 50 km to Arana√∫ Beach, where I camped in an unoccupied house and the neighbors kindly let me use a bathroom with a shower. A remarkable encounter there: I found a newborn kitten abandoned and crying. I sheltered her from the wind and gave her milk (later found out it‚Äôs not good for such young kittens). She slept with me in the hammock, inside my hoodie pocket. I decided to take her with me to see a vet. We left at 5 a.m., catching a beautiful sunrise along the beach.

properties.notes_pt: Dia de emo√ß√µes. Pedalei uns 20 km pela praia at√© o Pre√°, castigando a coitada da Nat√°lia (bike) com areia e √°gua salgada. E a gatinha no bolso do quadro tamb√©m reclamando de vez em quando. Pouco antes de chegar, um lado do meu alforge rasgou feio, tive que fazer uma gambiarra com um el√°stico pra segurar. No Pre√°, consegui levar a gatinha no pet shop, onde comprei e dei leite apropriado pra rec√©m nascidos. A veterin√°ria deu algumas orienta√ß√µes. At√© pensei em levar a gata comigo, mas ela √© muito pequenina e precisa de conforto e estabilidade, coisa que viajando de bike ela n√£o teria. Acabei ajudando com mais leites e a veterin√°ria ficou com ela at√© achar algu√©m pra adotar. Tamb√©m no Pre√° o camarada Asef costurou meu alforge, salvou. De tarde segui pra Cai√ßara ficar no camping Proibido N√£o Viver, pra ter mais conforto e por curiosidade de conhecer o casal viajante Renan e Larissa. Acabei ficando 2,5 dias e conheci muita gente bacana, v√°rios viajantes de bom cora√ß√£o. Rolou barzinho, pizza at√© karaoke e m√∫sica ao vivo! Tamb√©m passeei pelos buracos verde e azul e a lagoa do para√≠so.
properties.notes_en: An emotional day. I cycled about 20 km along the beach to Pre√°, giving poor Nat√°lia (my bike) a hard time with sand and salt water. The kitten in the frame pocket was also complaining from time to time. Shortly before arriving, one side of my pannier tore badly, and I had to improvise a fix with an elastic band. In Pre√°, I managed to take the kitten to a pet shop, where I bought proper milk for newborns. The vet gave me some guidance. I even thought about keeping her with me, but she‚Äôs too tiny and needs comfort and stability ‚Äî things impossible on a bike trip. I helped by buying more milk, and the vet agreed to keep her until finding someone to adopt her. Also in Pre√°, a guy named Asef sewed my pannier ‚Äî saved it! In the afternoon, I continued to Cai√ßara to stay at the 'Proibido N√£o Viver' camping, both for comfort and curiosity to meet the traveling couple Renan and Larissa. I ended up staying two and a half days, meeting lots of great people and kind-hearted travelers. There was a bar, pizza, karaoke, and even live music! I also visited some beautiful lagoons.

properties.notes_pt: Ap√≥s uns dias tranquilos em Cai√ßara, voltei a pedalar. Foi pouco mas deu pra cansar entre o Pre√° e Jeri, trechos de areia fofa tendo que empurrar a bike, e no fim a subida do Serrote. Mas que vista! E a descida deu pra curtir, no modo Nat MTB. Acabei ficando num camping tamb√©m em Jeri, almocei, cochilei e curti uma praia e p√¥r do sol das dunas.
properties.notes_en: After a few relaxing days in Cai√ßara, I got back on the bike. It wasn‚Äôt a long ride, but it was tiring between Pre√° and Jeri, with stretches of soft sand where I had to push the bike, and finally the climb up the Serrote hill. But what a view! The downhill was pure fun, Nat MTB mode. I ended up staying at a camping spot in Jeri as well, had lunch, took a nap, and enjoyed the beach and sunset from the dunes.

properties.notes_pt: Pedalei 40 km pela praia de manh√£, de Jeri at√© Camocim. O maior trecho de praia na viagem, felizmente em sua grande maioria com areia bem firme, e claro o vento nas costas sempre ajudando. Gratid√£o aos camaradas das balsas que n√£o me cobraram a travessia, tanto em Guri√∫ quanto pra Camocim. E gratid√£o aos camaradas de um restaurante em Camocim que n√£o s√≥ me deram a √°gua que eu tinha pedido pra lavar a bike, como me deram um prato de comida! üôå Tirei um leve cochilo numa pra√ßa esperando o sol baixar um pouco, onde conheci o PGH (pequeno grande homem), um noia local. Enfim mais 40 km at√© Barroquinha, j√° perto do Piau√≠! Tomei um banho num posto, comi um podr√£o na pra√ßa e acampei nela mesmo, cansado.
properties.notes_en: I cycled 40 km along the beach in the morning, from Jeri to Camocim ‚Äî the longest beach stretch of the trip, fortunately with mostly firm sand and, of course, the tailwind always helping. Grateful to the ferry guys who didn‚Äôt charge me for the crossings, both at Guri√∫ and to Camocim. And thanks to the folks at a restaurant in Camocim who not only gave me the water I asked for to wash the bike but also served me a plate of food! üôå I took a short nap in a square waiting for the sun to ease off, where I met PGH (Pequeno Grande Homem), a local wanderer. Finally, another 40 km to Barroquinha, already close to Piau√≠! Took a shower at a gas station, had a big street burger at the square, and camped there, exhausted.

properties.notes_pt: Cheguei no Piau√≠! Primeira vez nesse Estado. Resolvi fazer curso de kitesurf, que eu estava h√° muito tempo querendo e tenho passado por excelentes locais para a pr√°tica e na √©poca ideal. Fiquei no Borogodo, um hostel desativado onde fiz um combinado com a dona Amanda. Acabei ficando noites, entre curso de kite, ficar de boa na rede e roles com o pessoal ali da casa. Foi √≥timo pra recarregar as energias!
properties.notes_en: I arrived in Piau√≠ ‚Äî my first time in this state! I decided to take kitesurfing lessons, something I‚Äôd been wanting to do for a long time, and I‚Äôve been passing through amazing spots for it at the perfect time of year. I stayed at Borogod√≥, a deactivated hostel where I made an arrangement with the owner, Amanda. I ended up staying a few nights, between kite lessons, relaxing in the hammock, and hanging out with the people at the house. It was great to recharge my energy!

properties.notes_pt: O dia de Barra Grande pra Parna√≠ba foi inusitado. Peguei uma carona (paga) na lancha de um banana boat at√© a praia de Macap√°. L√° conheci uma fam√≠lia muito gente boa e passamos boa parte do dia juntos, primeiro ali na praia, depois almocei na casa deles, fomos em outra praia Maramar, conheci a irm√£/tia, um barzinho com um bode. Depois nos reencontramos em Atalaia 20 km adiante (nesse meio tempo estraguei o bico da c√¢mara e tive que botar a reserva üò¨) pro por do sol e um evento de corrida. Obrigado aos novos amigos! Enfim segui j√° escurecendo at√© Parna√≠ba, onde fui muito bem recebido pelo Leo, meu host de couchsurfing. No dia seguinte, domingo, fiz o passeio de barco no delta do Parna√≠ba, muito bom!
properties.notes_en: The day from Barra Grande to Parna√≠ba was quite unusual. I hitched a (paid) ride on a banana boat‚Äôs motor launch to Macap√° Beach. There I met a really nice family, and we spent most of the day together ‚Äî first on the beach, then I had lunch at their house, we went to another beach called Maramar, met the sister/aunt, and even stopped by a bar with a goat. Later, we met again in Atalaia, 20 km ahead (in the meantime I damaged my tube valve and had to use the spare üò¨) to watch the sunset and a running event. Thanks to these new friends! Finally, as night was falling, I continued to Parna√≠ba, where I was warmly welcomed by Leo, my Couchsurfing host. The next day, Sunday, I did a boat tour through the Parna√≠ba Delta ‚Äî amazing experience!

properties.notes_pt: Partida tardia esse dia pois de manh√£ estava em Parna√≠ba resenhando com o Leo e comprei c√¢maras novas pra Nat (por ter dado pt numa e danificado de leve outra). Almocei e descansei logo ap√≥s a divisa PI/MA. Segui com o sol j√° mais fraco at√© o fim do dia, pernoitei num posto de gasolina em Cana-Brava, onde fui muito bem acolhido pelos frentistas.
properties.notes_en: Late start that day, as I spent the morning in Parna√≠ba chatting with Leo and buying new tubes for Nat (since one was ruined and another slightly damaged). I had lunch and rested just after crossing the Piau√≠‚ÄìMaranh√£o border. Then I continued with the sun already lower until the end of the day, spending the night at a gas station in Cana-Brava, where I was warmly welcomed by the attendants.
